page.title: 14WALKS
page.content: Dartington and Totnes have several clearly marked walks. Those starting from Dartington are the Riverside walk, the Woodlands walk and the Farm trail. In Totnes there is the River walk from Swallowfields to the Bridge. The Riverside walk in Dartington is very short,about 1 km,and starts from the Cider Press Centre,along the Bidwell Brook,past the Tweed Mill,and back.The steep sides of the valley are covered in woodland,and the path passes an overgrown cider apple orchard.You may see Herons,Dippers, Mink,Water Voles,Trout and Bats.The Farm trail,about 3 km,leads from the Cider Press Centre to Old Parsonage farm.There is a herd of about 130 Dairy cows.In Chacegrove Wood you can see an extensive badger sett.
